Protes Ditahan, Pemilik 'Ngocok Yuk' : Jangan Negatif, Memang Dikocok Biar Enak
01 Nov 2019, 20:05 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw



Protes Ditahan, Pemilik 'Ngocok Yuk' : Jangan Negatif, Memang Dikocok Biar Enak



Protes Ditahan, Pemilik 'Ngocok Yuk' : Jangan Negatif, Memang Dikocok Biar Enak


KBRN, Jakarta : Satuan Polisi Pamong Praja (Satpol PP) Kota Padang mengamankan sekaligus menahan kendaraan branding dari sebuah produk minuman ringan waralaba bernama 'Ngocok', dengan tagline 'Ngocok Yuk', dan memiliki semboyan kuat 'Makin Dikocok Makin Nikmat'.Mobil branding minuman ringan 'Ngocok Yuk' diamankan petugas Satpol PP saat berada di kawasan Stadion Agus Salim, Kota Padang, Sumatera Barat (Sumbar), Kamis (31/10/2019).Menyikapi perlakuan petugas, pemilik kendaraan sekaligus franchise minuman segar tersebut yakni Winda Varesa protes keras. Dirinya menilai ia dan usahanya tidak bersalah. Bahkan Winda mengklaim, franchise 'Ngocok Yuk' sudah menyebar luas di berbagai daerah Indonesia dan menjadi minuman ringan yang laku keras.Seharusnya, kata Winda, Satpol PP Kota Padang tidak begitu saja semena-mena menangkap lalu menahan kendaraan usaha miliknya. Ada langkah-langkah yang harus ditempuh sebelum penangkapan, dari imbauan, kemudian mediasi dengan bertemu langsung, setelah itu baru diputuskan eksekusi akhirnya seperti apa."Saya tidak bisa bilang keliru atau gimana langkah yang dilakukan Satpol PP. (Seharusnya) Sebelum menangkap mediasi dulu, diimbau, lalu ada penjelasan. Kecuali melawan, baru tangkap. Ini main gerebek dan tangkap. Harusnya diimbau dan ada pemberitahuan, jangan ditangkap layaknya penjahat," ujar Winda kepada wartawan, seperti dilansir detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).Pada bagian lain, Anggota DPRD Kota Padang dari Fraksi Partai Amanat Nasional (PAN) Irawati Meuraksa mendukung langkah Satpol PP melakukan penahanan terhadap kendaraan minuman 'Ngocok Yuk' milik Winda Varesa. Irawati menilai, keputusan penangkapan dan penahanan sudah tepat karena demi menjaga ketertiban umum, sehingga Satpol PP perlu mengambil tindakan tegas."Banyak cara untuk berbisnis. untuk mencari popularitas, tapi baiknya tidak menggunakan nama-nama seperti itu. Membuat resah dan gaduh. Ini (Kota) Padang, bukan hanya soal banyaknya warga muslim, tapi juga aneh kalau dilihat orang-orang," tegas Irawati Meuraksa, Jumat (1/11/2019).Mendapat banyak serangan dan disudutkan lewat brand minuman 'Ngocok Yuk', Winda lantas kembali menjelaskan guna memberikan pencerahan kepada semua pihak bahwa usahanya bukanlah 'buruk moral dan norma' seperti yang dituduhkan.BACA JUGA: Resahkan Warga, Mobil Minuman 'Ngocok Yuk' Diangkut Satpol PP
Winda membantah 'Ngocok Yuk' dikonotasikan dengan sifat negatif. Menurutnya, brand 'Ngocok Yuk' diikuti lambang biji kopi gelas dan cokelat untuk mendeskripsikan produk minuman yang memberi kesegaran kepada konsumen."Gambarnya jelas itu minuman kopi, ada biji kopi dan ada cokelatnya. Kenapa 'Makin Dikocok Makin Nikmat'? Karena membuat minumannya memang dikocok dulu pakai shaker. Jadi sebelum diminum memang harus dikocok dulu biar makin enak," tutur Winda.Oleh karena itu, Winda bersikeras, kata 'Ngocok' tak bisa serta-merta dikonotasikan negatif, apalagi untuk produk makanan dan minuman. Kata 'Ngocok' juga dinilai lebih mudah dimaknai daripada sinonimnya."Kata 'kocok' lebih simpel dari 'diaduk'. Kocok (lebih) cocok untuk minuman, sementara 'aduk' cocok untuk makanan. Jadi itulah kenapa namanya 'Ngocok Yuk', dari singkatan dan dari cara penyajian juga berhubungan semua dengan kocokan," pungkasnya.Seperti diberitakan RRI sebelumnya, Warga Kota Padang, Sumatera Barat, dibuat resah oleh kehadiran sebuah kendaraan branding yang menjual minuman kopi coklat. Apa yang salah? Kenapa sampai warga resah dengan minuman ringan nan lezat itu?Ternyata, si pemilik usaha kopi coklat keliling itu kurang bisa menemukan istilah yang lebih sopan untuk menarik perhatian pembeli. 'Ngopi Cokelat', itulah branding si pemilik kendaraan untuk minuman andalannya.Nah, yang jadi masalah di sini adalah, si pemilik membuat singkatan 'Ngopi Coklat' menjadi kata yang cukup riskan diucapkan yakni 'Ngocok', sebagai akronim dari 'Ngopi Coklat'. Agar semakin heboh, ditambahkan tagline berbunyi 'Ngocok Yuk', 'Makin Dikocok Makin Nikmat'. Di sinilah masalah mulai datang. Masyarakat mulai tidak nyaman membaca tulisan itu, terlebih dibaca dan diulang-ulang oleh anak-anak sampai remaja di setiap tempat yang disinggahi kendaraan branding itu saat berjualan 'Kopi Cokelat'.Akibat keresahan dan aduan masyarakat itulah, Satpol PP Kota Padang, Sumatera Barat langsung bergerak mencari dimana keberadaan mobil tersebut. Akhirnya Satpol PP berhasil memergoki mobil tersebut sedang berdagang di kawasan Stadion Agus Salim, Kota Padang, Sumatera Barat. "Kami sita, karena meresahkan masyarakat. Banyak yang protes nama-nama seperti itu tak bagus untuk dilihat. Jadi kami menegakkan Perda Ketertiban Umum," ujar Kepala Satpol PP Kota Padang, Al Amin kepada wartawan, seperti dilansir detikcom, Kamis (31/10/2019).Selain penggunaan nama dan tagline yang menjurus 'porno' kata-kata seperti itu juga dinilai tidak layak menjadi konsumsi masyarakat karena sangat mengganggu dan melanggar norma-norma yang ada di tengah masyarakat itu sendiri.Untuk mengambil kembali mobil tersebut, pemiliknya, menurut Al Amin, harus membuat surat perjanjian agar mengganti nama 'Ngocok Yuk' dengan nama lain. Jika membandel, pihaknya mengancam akan membawa ke ranah hukum dengan perbuatan tindak pidana ringan. (Foto: Ist)

Protest Detained, Owner 'Shake It Out': Don't Be Negative, It Is Shaken To Be Delicious
01 Nov 2019, 20:05 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw



Protest Detained, Owner 'Shake It Out': Don't Be Negative, It Is Shaken To Be Delicious



Protest Detained, Owner 'Shake It Out': Don't Be Negative, It Is Shaken To Be Delicious


KBRN, Jakarta: Padang Municipal Civil Service Police Unit (Satpol PP) secures and holds the branding vehicle from a franchise soft drink product called 'Ngocok', with the tagline 'Ngukul Yuk', and has a strong motto 'More Shaken, More Enjoyable'. Car branding soft drink 'Ngukul Yuk' secured by Satpol PP officers while in the Agus Salim Stadium area, Padang City, West Sumatra (West Sumatra), Thursday (10/31/2019). Responding to the treatment of officers, vehicle owners as well as the fresh drink franchise namely Winda Varesa loud protest. He thinks he and his efforts are innocent. Even Winda claims, the 'Ngukul Yuk' franchise has spread widely in various regions of Indonesia and has become a soft drink that sells well. Supposedly, said Winda, the Padang City Police Satpol does not just arbitrarily catch and then hold his business vehicle. There are steps that must be taken before the arrest, from the appeal, then mediation by meeting in person, after that it was decided what the final execution was like. "I can't say wrong or how the steps taken by Satpol PP. (Supposedly) Before catching mediation first, appealed, then there was an explanation. Except fighting, just arresting. This is playing raids and arresting. It should be appealed and there is a notification, do not arrest like a criminal, "Winda told reporters, as reported by AFP on Friday (11/01/2019). another, Padang City DPRD member from the National Mandate Party (PAN) Faction Irawati Meuraksa supported the move of the Satpol PP to arrest the 'Ngukul Yuk' beverage vehicle owned by Winda Varesa. Irawati rate, arrest and detention decisions are right because in order to maintain public order, so Satpol PP needs to take decisive action. "There are many ways to do business. To look for popularity, but it's good not to use names like that. Make you uneasy and noisy. This ( City) Padang, it's not just a matter of the number of Muslims, but it's also strange to be seen by people, "said Irawati Meuraksa, Friday (11/01/2019). Got a lot of attacks and was cornered through the drink brand 'Ngukul Yuk', Winda then returned explain in order to give enlightenment to all parties that his business is not 'bad morals and norms' as alleged. READ ALSO: Disturbing Residents, Drinking Cars 'Ngukul Yuk' Transported by Satpol PP
Winda denies 'Ngukul Yuk' is connoted with a negative nature. According to him, the brand 'Ngukul Yuk' is followed by the symbol of glass coffee beans and chocolate to describe beverage products that give freshness to consumers. "The picture is clearly coffee drinks, there are coffee beans and chocolate. Why is 'More Shaken and More Delicious'? Because making drinks is indeed first shake it using a shaker. So before it is drunk it must be shaken first so that it becomes more delicious, "said Winda. Therefore, Winda insisted, the word 'Beat' cannot be connoted negatively, especially for food and beverage products. The word 'shake' is also judged to be more easily interpreted than the synonym. "The word 'shake' is simpler than 'stirring'. Shake (more) is suitable for drinks, while 'stir' is suitable for food. So that's why it's called 'Beat it', from the abbreviation and the way of presentation also relates to everything with the whisk, "he concluded. As reported by RRI earlier, Residents of the City of Padang, West Sumatra, were troubled by the presence of a branding vehicle that sold chocolate coffee drinks. What is wrong? Why do people get nervous about the delicious soft drink? Apparently, the owner of the mobile chocolate coffee business is less able to find a more polite term to attract the attention of buyers. 'Chocolate Coffee', that's the branding of the owner of the vehicle for its flagship beverage. Well, the problem here is, the owner makes the abbreviation 'Chocolate Coffee' into a rather risky word that is pronounced 'Ngukul', as an acronym for 'Chocolate Coffee'. In order to be more excited, added a tagline reading 'Let's Beat', 'The More Shaken the More Enjoyed'. This is where problems begin to come. The community began to feel uncomfortable reading the writings, especially read and repeated by children to adolescents in every place visited by the branding vehicle when selling 'Kopi Chocolate'. As a result of the unrest and complaints from the community, the municipal police in Padang, West Sumatra directly move to find where the car is. Finally Satpol PP managed to catch the car trading in the area of Agus Salim Stadium, Padang City, West Sumatra. "We seized it, because it unsettled the public. Many protested that such names were not good to look at. So we upheld the Public Order Law," Head of the Padang City Satpol PP, Al Amin, told reporters, as reported by AFP on Thursday (10/31) /2019).In addition to the use of names and taglines that lead to 'porn' such words are also considered unfit for consumption by the community because it is very disturbing and violates the norms that exist in the community itself. To retrieve the car, the owner, according to Al Amin, had to make a letter of agreement in order to replace the name 'Ngukul Yuk' with another name. If it is stubborn, it threatens to bring it into the realm of law with minor criminal acts. (Photo: Ist)
